body.name: A Man Called Justice: A Classic Western Series with Heart (Silent Justice Book 1)

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #3,324 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #1 in Old West History of the U.S. #13 in Western Fiction Classics #25 in Westerns (Books)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A book of morals that was refreshing. I, too, believe in miracles. The way Mr. Deacon presented Justice's miracle was very well done. My husband and I have never heard of silent justices, but doing research, we found out in the book of Revelation, the four horsemen could be where Mr. Deacon got his concept.This was a very action packed book. We look forward to reading book 2.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this on the recommendation of Dan Walsh-- a writer whose novels I always enjoy. Mr. Walsh said he didn't usually read westerns but this story grabbed him. I feel the same way. The author has a way of drawing you into the story and making you want to read more. Now I definitely have to read the next book in the series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A delightful story.
reviews.reviewText: I almost never read western novels, and those I do occasionally read are generally Louis L'amour or Zane Grey, but the description of this book intrigued me, so I bought it and am glad that I did.The story is simple enough. A man is beaten, shot and killed by outlaws, but somehow a lightning strike brings him back to life and, after being nursed back to health, he sets out for revenge (or justice if you will) from those who killed him. Along the way he finds love with a frontier family but continues to be haunted by not knowing who he is or what is past was.The story is simple enough, the characters interesting, although not fully fleshed out, and there is no gray here. The good guys are good, the bad guys are very bad and the action is simple and straight forward. While this might sound like the book is boring it is anything but, and I finished it in a little over a day. In fact I found it so interesting that I abandoned the other book I was reading to finish this one first, and expect to buy the next book in the series. The writing is clear, things are resolved quickly and, surprisingly, I found the story hard to put down.For someone who generally does not read western novels I thought the book was a great change of pace.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nora and Eli
reviews.reviewText: I'm hooked on Justice. I've always loved western movies but never read a western book! Can't imagine why?This story shows how neighbors and true gentlemen should treat one another. I truly believe there are really good and some really bad people out there.This story shows us both. In a very GRAND way. Thanks, I can't wait to read JUSTICE RETURNS!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good start to the series
reviews.reviewText: Hey there book lovers! It is your old pal, Ninetoes, coming at you with a review of John Deacon’s A Man Called Justice. I have my thinking cap on, and coffee in my system so let’s do this!I have always been of the frame of mind that 99.9% of your Westerns fall into two categories: John Wayne where there is some violence and minimal bloodshed and the line between good and evil is as sharp as a razor, and Clint Eastwood where the violence abounds, bullets fly and the line between good and evil is hazy.John Deacon’s A Man Called Justice falls into the John Wayne camp. It starts with a woman and her son at a river and they see four men dragging a man behind them on horseback. The man is strung up on a tree like Christ on the cross, and he is left for dead. Before the men leave, one pins a badge on the man’s chest. After they leave, the woman cuts the man down and she prays for him. A freak bolt of lightning lashes out and hits the badge, bringing the man back to life. She takes him back to her home and nurses him back to health. He has no recollection of his past, none at all. He sees the word “Justice” on his badge and that’s what he takes as his name. Now Justice has a mission. Get the men who killed him, find the missing pieces of his past, and protect the woman and her son.This book is tagged as a “Western with heart”, and it does have that. The writing is sharp, and the pace is as fast as a bullet. Some of the action is over too fast, and some points get repetitive, but I understand why the repetition is there. This has all the hallmarks of a good Western: A noble hero, a strong female, a ruthless land baron, and evil men who do not care about the pain they inflict. Oh yeah, and an incredible sense of justice and revenge. The shootouts are necessary and not just there for the sake of being there or adding to a word count. There are three more books in the series and I plan to get the rest!I give this one 4.5 bookmarks out of 5!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars a true old time western classic
reviews.reviewText: The author did a great job writing a cowboy story like I remember them many years ago. The main character Justus was truly a white hat and the bad guy’s Black hats. And Justice’s truly won out. Great read recommend it to any one who wants a break from the present day problem.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Man on a mission.
reviews.reviewText: This was a good book that kept my interest. It had a couple unbelievable plot twists but it's a novel so I could live with them.. The character development provided insight into the people involved. I didn't mind the romantic element but it was mentioned time and time again, hence the 4 stars instead of 5. It was just too much that just seemed to be added to pad the number of words/pages. In spite of that, I would recommend it for some light reading.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just clean fun
reviews.reviewText: Couldn’t put it down. Honor, integrity, good guys, really bad guys, can’t decide whose side I want to be on guys, the difference between killing and murder, revenge because it’s the right thing to do…this clean book has it all. Keep writing, Mr. Deacon, it’s your gift to us all.
This was just a fun read. No profanity or sex. Clear distinction between the good guys and bad guys. It reminded me of the movie Pale Rider.A great old fashioned western.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Thank you John Deacon.It’s quite a while since I read a western book and this was a brilliant read.When I was a lot younger, about 50yrs ago, I read a full series of westerns called Edge by George G Gilman (I think) and these books remind me of Edge.A great read, now for the rest, I already have the next three
I really enjoy a good western and this was one of the best I have ever read. I liked the way the story flowed. The characters were all realistic , problems and all.

reviews.reviewTitle: A book that captured my interest and was worth the purchase
reviews.reviewText: This book captured my interest from the beginning and carried on through to the end. I enjoyed it so much I purchased the other three books in the series and read them right away. Hope the series continues.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Finally after searching for a good Western author I came across John deacon, really good, well written story a bit like C.J.Petit but without the mushy parts.Read all of CJs books ( some 2 or 3 times ) because I couldn't find author I liked apart from the great Louis L'Amour who has sadly passed on, CJs were easy to read and you knew the outcome ( maybe not the details) within the first few chapters but JD excelled CJ with more action and less mush, tried A.Grayson, R.O.Lane, B.Rundell, but they didn't hold my attention so glad I found JD. Gonna buy the next 3 books to the set. If you like westerns then look no further, John Deacons the man to watch
